subject: Self Care
title: Sleep as a Habit
description: A fast breakdown of Sleep as a Habit for builders.

hook.text: You don't just fall asleep at random. Sleep is a habit that responds to cues, routines, and rewards.

buildup.text: Consistent bedtimes create a cue. The wind-down routine is the behavior. Feeling rested is the reward.

discovery.text: People with consistent sleep schedules fall asleep faster and wake more refreshed than variable sleepers.

twist.text: Weekend sleep-ins feel great but disrupt the habit loop. Your body clock doesn't understand Saturdays.

climax.text: Treat sleep like your most important appointment. Same time, same routine, every single night.

punchline.text: Schedule sleep like a meeting you can't miss.

quiz.question: Why do consistent sleep schedules improve sleep quality?
options: The mattress adapts to your schedule
The body clock synchronizes, making sleep onset faster
